canonical_explanation.text: Force is a push or pull that can change the state of motion, direction, or shape of an object. Forces can be contact forces (like friction, muscular force) or non-contact forces (like gravity, magnetic force, electrostatic force). Friction is a force that opposes motion between two surfaces in contact. Friction can be static, sliding, or rolling. While friction causes wear and tear, it is also essential for walking, writing, and braking. Balanced forces result in no change in motion, while unbalanced forces cause acceleration or deceleration.
rules: Force is a push or pull acting on an object.
Force can change speed, direction, or shape of an object.
Contact forces: friction, muscular force, tension.
Non-contact forces: gravity, magnetic force, electrostatic force.
Friction opposes relative motion between surfaces.
Rolling friction < Sliding friction < Static friction.
Balanced forces cause no change in motion.
Unbalanced forces cause change in motion.

questions.question_text: Force is defined as:
questions.explanation_correct: Force is defined as a push or pull because it can change the state of motion, direction, or shape of an object. A force is not just a push or just a pull, but a combination of both. This is the correct definition of force.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Force is not just defined as a speed of an object. Speed is a measure of how fast an object is moving, while force is the push or pull that can cause an object to change its speed, direction, or shape. The correct definition of force is a push or pull that can affect the motion or shape of an object.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an effect of force?
questions.explanation_correct: Force is a push or pull that can change the speed or motion of an object. If a force is applied to an object, it can cause the object to speed up, slow down, or change direction. Therefore, change in speed is an effect of force.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A change in temperature or color is not a direct effect of force. Force can cause an object to change its speed or motion, but it does not affect the weight of an object. The correct answer is 'Change in speed' because force can alter the speed or motion of an object.

questions.question_text: A force can change the:
questions.explanation_correct: A force can change the shape of an object by applying a push or a pull on it. For example, if you squeeze a sponge, the force changes its shape. This is because a force can deform or change the shape of an object.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A force cannot change the mass, color, or temperature of an object. Mass is a property of the object itself and does not change due to forces acting on it. Color and temperature are also properties that are not affected by forces. Only the shape of an object can be changed by the application of a force.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a contact force?
questions.explanation_correct: Friction is a contact force because it acts between two surfaces that are in physical contact with each other. When one surface moves over another, there is a force that opposes this motion, which is called friction. This makes friction a contact force.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Gravitational force, magnetic force, and electrostatic force are all non-contact forces. This means they can act on objects without the objects being in physical contact. For example, the Earth's gravity pulls on the Moon even though they are not touching. Friction, on the other hand, is a contact force that acts between two surfaces in contact with each other.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a non-contact force?
questions.explanation_correct: Magnetic force is a non-contact force, meaning it can act on an object without touching it. This is because magnetic fields can extend out into the surrounding space and exert a force on magnetic materials like iron. Other examples of non-contact forces are gravity and electrostatic force.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Muscular force, friction, and tension are all examples of contact forces. These forces require direct physical interaction between two objects to work. For example, friction is the force that acts between two surfaces in contact with each other, which opposes their relative motion. Non-contact forces like magnetism can work without any physical contact between the objects.

questions.question_text: Friction is a force that:
questions.explanation_correct: Friction is a force that opposes motion between two surfaces in contact. It tries to slow down or stop the motion of an object. This is why friction is considered a force that opposes motion.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Friction is not a force that helps motion, creates motion, or has no effect on motion. Friction is a force that acts against the motion of an object, trying to slow it down or stop it. This is why option B, 'opposes motion', is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: What causes friction between two surfaces?
questions.explanation_correct: The roughness of the surfaces causes friction between them. When two surfaces are in contact, the tiny bumps and grooves on their surfaces interact with each other, creating resistance to their relative motion. This resistance is known as friction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The color, temperature, or size of the surfaces does not affect the amount of friction between them. Friction is mainly caused by the roughness or unevenness of the surfaces in contact. The more rough or uneven the surfaces are, the greater the friction between them will be.

questions.question_text: When two forces acting on an object are equal and opposite, they are called:
questions.explanation_correct: When two forces acting on an object are equal in size and opposite in direction, they are called balanced forces. This means the object will not experience any change in motion or acceleration.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is B) Balanced forces. Balanced forces are when two forces acting on an object are equal in size and opposite in direction, like pushing and pulling an object with the same amount of force. This results in no change in the object's motion. Unbalanced forces, frictional forces, and gravitational forces are all different types of forces that can act on an object, but they are not the same as balanced forces.

questions.question_text: The force exerted by our muscles is called:
questions.explanation_correct: The force exerted by our muscles is called muscular force. This is because our muscles contract and exert a force to move our body parts and perform various tasks.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not the correct answer. Gravitational force is the force exerted by the Earth on objects, frictional force is the force that opposes the motion between two surfaces, and magnetic force is the force exerted by a magnet. The force exerted by our muscles is called muscular force.

questions.question_text: Which type of friction is usually the smallest?
questions.explanation_correct: Rolling friction is usually the smallest type of friction. This is because when an object rolls on a surface, there is less resistance compared to when it slides or stays stationary. The rolling action creates a smooth, low-friction movement.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other types of friction (static and sliding friction) are usually larger than rolling friction. Static friction occurs when an object is at rest and resists starting to move. Sliding friction happens when an object is moving across a surface, causing more resistance than rolling. Rolling friction has the least amount of resistance, making it the smallest type of friction.

questions.question_text: Wheels are used in vehicles to:

options.text: Convert sliding friction to rolling friction

questions.explanation_correct: Wheels are used in vehicles to convert sliding friction to rolling friction. When a vehicle is moving, the wheels roll on the ground instead of sliding, which reduces the amount of friction. This makes the vehicle easier to move and saves energy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wheels do not increase friction or make vehicles heavier. Instead, they convert the sliding friction between the vehicle and the ground to rolling friction, which is much lower. This allows the vehicle to move more efficiently and use less energy.

questions.question_text: Oil is applied to machine parts to:
questions.explanation_correct: Oil is applied to machine parts to reduce friction. Friction is a force that opposes the motion between two surfaces in contact. Applying oil creates a smooth surface and reduces the contact between the parts, which decreases the friction and makes the machine work more efficiently.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Oil is not applied to machine parts to increase friction, make them heavier, or change their color. Increasing friction would make the machine work harder and use more energy, which is not desirable. Oil is used to reduce friction and make the machine parts move more smoothly with less resistance.

questions.question_text: Treads are provided on tyres to:
questions.explanation_correct: Treads on tyres increase the friction between the tyre and the road, which helps the vehicle grip the road better and prevents it from slipping. This is important for safe driving, especially on wet or slippery surfaces.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct. Reducing friction would actually make the tyres less grippy on the road. Tyres are designed to look functional, not just aesthetically pleasing. The weight of the tyres is not a major concern, as the tread design is more important for improving traction.

questions.question_text: When you kick a football, which effect of force is demonstrated?
questions.explanation_correct: When you kick a football, the force applied changes the motion of the football, causing it to move. This demonstrates the effect of force on changing the motion of an object.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Kicking a football does not change its shape, color, or temperature. The force applied during the kick changes the motion of the football, making option C the correct answer. The force causes the football to start moving or changes its direction of motion.

questions.question_text: A magnet attracting an iron nail is an example of:
questions.explanation_correct: A magnet attracting an iron nail is an example of a non-contact force. A non-contact force is a force that acts on an object without physically touching it. The magnetic force between the magnet and the iron nail is a non-contact force, since the magnet pulls the nail towards it without actually touching it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct because: A) Contact force is a force that requires direct physical contact between two objects, like friction or pushing. B) This is the correct answer, as explained above. C) Frictional force is a contact force that opposes motion between two surfaces in contact. D) Muscular force is also a contact force, where your muscles apply a push or pull on an object.

questions.question_text: A book lying on a table does not move because:
questions.explanation_correct: The book lying on the table does not move because the forces acting on it are balanced. The downward force of gravity (weight) is balanced by the upward force of the table, so the net force on the book is zero. This means the book remains stationary and does not accelerate.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The book is not moving because the forces acting on it are balanced, not because no force is acting on it. Gravity is still pulling down on the book, but the table is pushing up with an equal force. The forces are balanced, so the book stays in place. It is also not true that the book does not move because it is very heavy - the weight of the book is not the only factor determining whether it moves or not.

questions.question_text: Why is it difficult to walk on a slippery floor?
questions.explanation_correct: It is difficult to walk on a slippery floor because there is very low friction between your shoes and the floor. Friction is the force that helps you grip the surface and walk normally. When friction is low, your feet can easily slide on the floor, making it hard to walk without falling.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The difficulty in walking on a slippery floor is not because the friction is very high. In fact, it is the opposite - the friction is very low. High friction would actually make it easier to walk, as your feet would have a better grip on the surface. Gravity and the temperature of the floor do not affect the ability to walk in this case.

questions.question_text: Pressing a lump of clay changes its shape. This shows that force can:

options.text: Change the colour of an object
Change the shape of an object
Change the mass of an object
Change the temperature of an object

questions.explanation_correct: When a force is applied to a lump of clay, it changes the shape of the clay. This shows that force can change the shape of an object.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Pressing a lump of clay does not change its color, mass, or temperature. It only changes the shape of the clay. Therefore, option B is the correct answer that shows force can change the shape of an object.

questions.question_text: An apple falling from a tree is due to:
questions.explanation_correct: The apple falling from a tree is due to the gravitational force. Gravity is a force that pulls objects towards the center of the Earth. This is a non-contact force that attracts objects with mass, like the apple, towards the ground.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The apple falling from the tree is not due to magnetic force, frictional force, or muscular force. Magnetic force acts between magnetic objects, frictional force acts between surfaces in contact, and muscular force is a force exerted by the muscles. In this case, the apple is falling due to the Earth's gravitational pull, which is a non-contact force that attracts objects with mass towards the ground.

questions.question_text: For an object to accelerate, the forces acting on it must be:
questions.explanation_correct: For an object to accelerate, the forces acting on it must be unbalanced. This means that the net force (the vector sum of all the forces) is not zero. Unbalanced forces will cause the object to change its speed or direction, resulting in acceleration.
questions.explanation_incorrect: If the forces acting on an object are balanced, meaning the net force is zero, the object will not accelerate. It will either remain at rest or continue to move at a constant speed. Balanced forces do not cause acceleration. The correct answer is that unbalanced forces must be acting on the object for it to accelerate.

questions.question_text: Ball bearings are used in machines to:

options.text: Convert sliding friction to rolling friction

questions.explanation_correct: Ball bearings are used in machines to convert sliding friction to rolling friction. Sliding friction is a force that opposes the motion between two surfaces that are sliding against each other. Rolling friction, on the other hand, is a much smaller force that occurs when an object rolls on a surface. By using ball bearings, the sliding friction is reduced, making the machine work more efficiently.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct. Increasing sliding friction would make the machine work harder, not more efficiently. Increasing static friction would also not help the machine work better. And making the machine heavier would not reduce the friction inside the machine.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT an advantage of friction?

options.text: Wear and tear of machine parts

questions.explanation_correct: Wear and tear of machine parts is not an advantage of friction. Friction causes wear and damage to the surfaces in contact, leading to gradual deterioration of machine parts over time. This is generally seen as a disadvantage of friction, as it requires regular maintenance and repair of machines.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Friction is essential for many everyday activities like walking, holding objects, and braking vehicles. Friction allows us to grip surfaces and move around, and it helps slow down vehicles when we apply the brakes. However, the wear and tear caused by friction on machine parts is not an advantage, as it leads to the gradual breakdown of the machines over time.

questions.question_text: The force between a comb and small pieces of paper after rubbing is:
questions.explanation_correct: The force between a comb and small pieces of paper after rubbing is an electrostatic force. Rubbing the comb creates a static electric charge on it, which then attracts the small paper pieces through the electrostatic force.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The force between the comb and paper is not a gravitational force, as gravitational forces act between objects with mass. It is also not a magnetic force, as the comb does not have a magnetic field. Finally, it is not a frictional force, as friction requires direct contact between surfaces, which is not the case here. The correct answer is the electrostatic force, which is created by the static electric charge on the comb after rubbing.

questions.question_text: Why do gymnasts apply powder to their hands?

options.text: To increase grip by absorbing sweat

questions.explanation_correct: Gymnasts apply powder to their hands to increase their grip by absorbing sweat. This helps them maintain a strong hold on the equipment and perform their routines safely and effectively.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Applying powder to their hands does not reduce friction, as friction is essential for gymnasts to have a good grip on the equipment. Powdering their hands also doesn't cool them down or make their hands look white. The main reason gymnasts use powder is to absorb sweat and improve their grip, which allows them to perform their routines with better control and stability.

questions.question_text: When a goalkeeper catches a fast-moving ball, the ball stops. This shows that force can:

options.text: Change the colour of the ball
Change the size of the ball

questions.explanation_correct: When the goalkeeper catches a fast-moving ball, the force applied by the goalkeeper's hands stops the ball's motion, showing that force can stop a moving object.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The force applied by the goalkeeper does not change the color, weight, or size of the ball. It only stops the ball's motion by applying an opposing force. The correct option is that force can stop a moving object, which is what happens when the ball is caught.

questions.question_text: Friction produces:
questions.explanation_correct: Friction produces both heat and causes wear on the surfaces in contact. As objects move over each other, the friction between them generates heat and causes the surfaces to gradually wear down over time.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Friction does not just produce heat, it also causes the surfaces in contact to wear down. As the surfaces rub against each other, tiny bits of material are gradually removed, leading to wear and tear. This is why friction is important for things like walking and braking, but it can also damage surfaces if not managed properly.

questions.question_text: When you push a wall but it does not move, the forces are:
questions.explanation_correct: When you push a wall but it does not move, the forces are balanced. This means that the force you apply to push the wall is exactly equal to the force the wall applies back, causing the wall to not move at all.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The forces are not unbalanced, as the wall does not move. Unbalanced forces would cause the wall to accelerate or change its motion. The forces are also not absent, as there is a clear push being applied. Finally, the forces are not just gravitational, as there are other forces like the push you apply that are also acting on the wall.

questions.question_text: Which force keeps planets moving around the Sun?
questions.explanation_correct: The force that keeps planets moving around the Sun is the gravitational force. The Sun's gravity pulls the planets towards it, causing them to orbit the Sun in elliptical paths. This gravitational force is a non-contact force that acts between the Sun and the planets, keeping the planets in their orbits.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is the gravitational force. Magnetic force and muscular force are not responsible for the motion of planets around the Sun. Frictional force is a contact force that acts between two surfaces in contact, but there is no significant friction between the planets and the Sun in their orbits.

questions.question_text: The soles of shoes are made rough to:
questions.explanation_correct: The soles of shoes are made rough to increase friction, which provides better grip and traction. This helps us walk, run, and move around more securely without slipping.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The soles are not made rough to reduce friction, as that would make it harder to walk and move around. They are also not made rough just to look good or to make the shoes lighter. The rough surface increases friction, which is the key reason for this design to provide better grip and prevent slipping.

questions.question_text: A stretched rubber band has the ability to do work because of:
questions.explanation_correct: A stretched rubber band has the ability to do work because it stores elastic energy. When you stretch the rubber band, you apply a force that stores potential energy in the rubber band. This stored energy can then be used to do work, such as launching a projectile or closing a door.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct because: A) Gravitational force does not store energy in the rubber band, C) Magnetic force is not involved in a stretched rubber band, and D) Frictional force opposes motion, it does not store energy.

questions.question_text: Force is a push or pull acting on an object.
questions.explanation_correct: The statement 'Force is a push or pull acting on an object' is correct. Force is a physical quantity that can change the motion, shape, or direction of an object. It is the cause that produces or tries to produce a change in the state of an object.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement 'Force is a push or pull acting on an object' is incorrect. This is because force is not just a push or pull, but it is a physical quantity that can change the motion, shape, or direction of an object. Force is the cause that produces or tries to produce a change in the state of an object.

questions.question_text: Gravitational force is a contact force.
questions.explanation_correct: Gravitational force is a non-contact force. It is an attractive force that acts between any two objects with mass, even if they are not touching each other.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Gravitational force is not a contact force. It acts between objects that are separated by a distance, without them needing to be in physical contact. This is different from contact forces like friction, which require the objects to be touching each other.

questions.question_text: Friction always opposes motion.
questions.explanation_correct: Friction always opposes motion, as it creates a force that tries to slow down or stop the object that is moving. Even when an object is not moving, friction can still exist in the form of static friction, which opposes any attempt to make the object move.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is true. Friction is a force that always opposes the motion of an object. It creates a force that tries to slow down or stop the object that is moving. Even when an object is not moving, friction can still exist in the form of static friction, which opposes any attempt to make the object move.

questions.question_text: Rolling friction is greater than sliding friction.
questions.explanation_correct: Rolling friction is less than sliding friction because the rolling motion involves less surface contact and less resistance compared to sliding motion.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement 'Rolling friction is greater than sliding friction' is false. When an object rolls, the surface contact is less compared to when it slides, so the friction force is lower. Sliding friction is generally greater than rolling friction because there is more surface area in contact during sliding.

questions.question_text: Balanced forces cause a change in the motion of an object.
questions.explanation_correct: Balanced forces do not cause a change in the motion of an object. When the forces acting on an object are balanced, meaning the net force is zero, the object will remain at rest or continue moving at a constant speed. There is no acceleration or deceleration.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement 'Balanced forces cause a change in the motion of an object' is false. Balanced forces, which means the net force acting on an object is zero, will not change the object's motion. The object will either remain at rest or continue moving at a constant speed. Only unbalanced forces can cause a change in the object's motion, such as acceleration or deceleration.

questions.question_text: Lubricants are used to reduce friction in machines.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, this statement is true. Lubricants are used to reduce friction in machines. Lubricants create a smooth surface between moving parts, which reduces the amount of friction and wear and tear on the machine.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is correct. Lubricants are used to reduce friction in machines. When moving parts in a machine rub against each other, it creates a lot of friction, which can cause the machine to wear out quickly. By applying a lubricant, such as oil or grease, between the moving parts, the friction is reduced, and the machine can work more efficiently and last longer.

questions.question_text: Magnetic force can act without physical contact.
questions.explanation_correct: The statement is true. Magnetic force is a non-contact force, which means it can act on objects without them having to touch. This is because magnets create an invisible magnetic field around them that can affect other magnetic objects, even from a distance.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is true. Magnetic force is a non-contact force, which means it can act on objects without them having to touch. This is because magnets create an invisible magnetic field around them that can affect other magnetic objects, even from a distance. Some people may think that magnetic force requires physical contact, but this is not the case.

questions.question_text: Force can change the direction of a moving object.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, force can change the direction of a moving object. A force acting on an object can make it change its direction of motion, even if the object was moving in a straight line before.
questions.explanation_incorrect: No, this statement is not correct. Force can indeed change the direction of a moving object. When a force is applied to an object, it can make the object change its direction of motion, even if it was moving in a straight line earlier. So the statement 'Force can change the direction of a moving object' is true.

questions.question_text: Without friction, we would not be able to walk.
questions.explanation_correct: Without friction, we would not be able to walk. Friction between our feet and the ground is what allows us to push off and move forward. If there was no friction, our feet would just slide and we would not be able to apply force to the ground to walk.
questions.explanation_incorrect: It is false that without friction, we would not be able to walk. Friction is actually essential for walking. When we take a step, the friction between our feet and the ground allows us to push off and move forward. If there was no friction, our feet would just slide and we would not be able to walk properly.

questions.question_text: Unbalanced forces are needed to move a stationary object.
questions.explanation_correct: Unbalanced forces are needed to move a stationary object because a stationary object will remain still unless an unbalanced force is applied to it. Only unbalanced forces can cause an object to start moving or change its speed or direction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is true. Unbalanced forces are needed to move a stationary object. If the forces acting on an object are balanced, meaning the forces are equal in magnitude and opposite in direction, the object will remain stationary. It is the unbalanced forces, where the net force is not zero, that can cause the object to start moving or change its speed or direction.

questions.question_text: Force is a ___ or pull acting on an object.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is 'push' because a force is a push or a pull acting on an object. A force can change the state of motion, direction, or shape of an object. The definition of a force includes both pushing and pulling on an object.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is 'push'. The question is asking you to fill in the blank with the correct type of force, which is a push. Force is not a 'pull' acting on an object, it is a push or a pull. A force can change the state of motion, direction, or shape of an object, and it includes both pushing and pulling on an object.

questions.question_text: ___ is the force that opposes the motion between two surfaces in contact.
questions.explanation_correct: Friction is the force that opposes the motion between two surfaces in contact. When two surfaces rub against each other, friction creates a force that works against the motion, slowing down or stopping the object.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'Friction'. Friction is the force that acts between two surfaces that are in contact with each other and is responsible for opposing the motion of an object. Other forces, like gravity or muscular force, do not specifically oppose the motion between two surfaces in contact.

questions.question_text: Gravitational force is an example of a ___-contact force.
questions.explanation_correct: Gravitational force is an example of a non-contact force because it acts between objects without them having to touch each other. The Earth's gravitational pull on an object, like an apple, is an example of a non-contact force since the apple does not need to be in direct contact with the Earth to experience the pull of gravity.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format for this fill-in-the-blank question is 'non'. Gravitational force is a non-contact force because it acts between objects without them having to touch each other. This means the gravitational pull of the Earth on an object, like an apple, does not require the apple to be in direct physical contact with the Earth.

questions.question_text: When forces are equal and opposite, they are called ___ forces.
questions.explanation_correct: When forces acting on an object are equal in magnitude and opposite in direction, they are called balanced forces. This means that the net force acting on the object is zero, so the object's motion will not change.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer would be 'unbalanced forces'. Unbalanced forces are forces that are not equal in magnitude and opposite in direction. When forces are unbalanced, the net force acting on the object is not zero, and the object will accelerate or decelerate. The correct answer is 'balanced forces', which means the forces are equal and opposite, resulting in no change in the object's motion.

questions.question_text: ___ friction is less than sliding friction.
questions.explanation_correct: Rolling friction is less than sliding friction because in rolling motion, the object rolls on the surface without sliding, resulting in lower frictional forces compared to sliding motion where the object slides across the surface.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'Rolling'. Rolling friction is lower than sliding friction because in rolling motion, the object rolls on the surface without sliding, which creates less frictional force compared to sliding motion where the object slides across the surface. The accepted answer format for this fill-in-the-blank question is a single word, 'Rolling'.

questions.question_text: Oil and grease are called ___ and are used to reduce friction.
questions.explanation_correct: Oil and grease are called lubricants, and they are used to reduce friction between two surfaces that are in contact. Lubricants create a smooth, slippery layer between the surfaces, making it easier for them to slide past each other with less resistance or friction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'lubricants'. Oil and grease are not the same as friction, but they help reduce friction between surfaces. Friction is the force that opposes the motion between two surfaces in contact, while lubricants are substances that are used to reduce this friction and make the surfaces slide more easily.

questions.question_text: The force exerted by a magnet on iron is called ___ force.
questions.explanation_correct: The force exerted by a magnet on iron is called magnetic force because magnets are able to attract certain metals like iron due to their magnetic properties. This force between the magnet and the iron is a type of non-contact force, known as the magnetic force.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The force exerted by a magnet on iron is not called 'contact' force. This is because magnetic force is a non-contact force, meaning the magnet and the iron do not need to be in physical contact for the force to be exerted. The correct term for this force is 'magnetic force', as magnets can attract iron objects through the magnetic field they create.

questions.question_text: Force can change the ___ of motion of an object.
questions.explanation_correct: Force can change the direction of motion of an object. For example, if you push a ball, it will start moving in the direction you pushed it. Force can make an object change its direction of motion.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'direction'. Force can change the direction of motion of an object, but it cannot change the 'state' of motion. The state of motion refers to whether the object is moving or not, and force can only change the speed or velocity of an object, not whether it is moving or not.

questions.question_text: The friction that prevents a stationary object from moving is called ___ friction.
questions.explanation_correct: The friction that prevents a stationary object from moving is called static friction. This is because when an object is not moving, the force between the surfaces in contact is static or at rest, which prevents the object from starting to move.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format for this fill-in-the-blank question is 'static'. The friction that prevents a stationary object from moving is called static friction, not sliding or rolling friction. Static friction is the force that acts between two surfaces that are not in motion relative to each other, and it is what keeps a stationary object from starting to move.

questions.question_text: ___ forces cause a change in the state of motion of an object.
questions.explanation_correct: Unbalanced forces cause a change in the state of motion of an object. When the forces acting on an object are not equal and opposite, they create an unbalanced force. This unbalanced force causes the object to accelerate or decelerate, changing its motion.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Balanced forces do not cause a change in the state of motion of an object. When the forces acting on an object are equal and opposite, they create a balanced force. In this case, the object will not accelerate or decelerate, and its motion will remain constant. The correct answer is 'Unbalanced' forces, which can change the state of motion of an object.

questions.question_text: The pull of Earth on all objects is called ___ force.
questions.explanation_correct: The pull of the Earth on all objects is called the gravitational force. This is because the Earth's gravity pulls all objects towards its center, causing them to experience a downward force.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format for this question is 'gravitational'. The pull of the Earth on all objects is not called the 'magnetic' force or the 'electrostatic' force. These are different types of non-contact forces. The gravitational force is the force that the Earth exerts on all objects, causing them to be pulled towards the Earth's center.

questions.question_text: Friction between surfaces in contact increases with the ___ of surfaces.
questions.explanation_correct: The roughness of the surfaces in contact increases friction because it creates more microscopic points of contact between the surfaces, making it harder for them to slide past each other. The more uneven the surfaces, the greater the friction force that opposes their motion.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is 'roughness'. Friction increases when the surfaces in contact have a higher roughness or unevenness. This is because the rougher the surfaces, the more points of contact between them, making it harder for them to slide past each other. The accepted answer format is a single word, 'roughness'.

questions.question_text: Arrange the types of friction from greatest to least:
questions.explanation_correct: The types of friction are arranged from greatest to least as: Static friction, Sliding friction, Rolling friction. This is because static friction, which is the friction between two surfaces that are not moving, is the strongest. Sliding friction, which is the friction between two surfaces that are moving, is less than static friction. Rolling friction, which is the friction between a rolling object and the surface it is rolling on, is the least among the three types of friction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct order from greatest to least friction is: Static friction, Sliding friction, Rolling friction. Static friction is the highest because it is the force that must be overcome to start an object moving. Sliding friction is lower than static friction because it acts on a moving object. Rolling friction is the lowest because it involves less contact between the surfaces compared to static or sliding friction.

questions.question_text: Arrange the following methods from most effective to least effective in reducing friction:
questions.explanation_correct: Using wheels is the most effective method to reduce friction because wheels allow an object to roll instead of slide, which greatly reduces the friction force. Polishing surfaces is the next most effective, as it reduces the roughness between the surfaces and lowers the friction. No treatment at all would be the least effective, as the surfaces would have higher friction without any modifications.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct order from most effective to least effective in reducing friction is: Using wheels, Polishing surfaces, No treatment. Using wheels is the most effective because it allows the object to roll instead of slide, which reduces the friction force. Polishing the surfaces is the next best option as it reduces the roughness between the surfaces and lowers the friction. Leaving the surfaces untreated, or 'No treatment', would be the least effective in reducing friction.

questions.question_text: Arrange the sequence of events when you kick a stationary football:
ordering_items: Ball eventually stops due to friction
correct_answer: Ball eventually stops due to friction
questions.explanation_correct: The sequence of events when kicking a stationary football is: 1) Foot moves towards ball, 2) Foot applies force on ball, 3) Ball moves forward, 4) Ball eventually stops due to friction. This is because the foot first needs to move towards the ball and apply a force, which then makes the ball move forward. The ball then stops due to the friction force acting on it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: 1) Ball moves forward, 2) Foot applies force on ball, 3) Foot moves towards ball, 4) Ball eventually stops due to friction. This is wrong because the foot needs to first move towards the ball and apply a force in order for the ball to start moving forward. The ball cannot move forward before the foot applies a force on it.

questions.question_text: Arrange the following surfaces from highest friction to lowest friction:
questions.explanation_correct: The friction between two surfaces depends on the roughness of the surfaces. Sandpaper has the highest friction, followed by rough concrete, smooth glass, and ice surface which has the lowest friction. This is because the rougher the surface, the more the interlocking of the surfaces, leading to higher friction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be to arrange the surfaces from lowest friction to highest friction. This is because the smoother the surface, the lower the friction. Ice surface has the lowest friction, followed by smooth glass, rough concrete, and sandpaper which has the highest friction. The reason for this order is that the rougher the surface, the more the interlocking of the surfaces, leading to higher friction.

questions.question_text: Arrange the following forces as contact forces first, then non-contact forces:
questions.explanation_correct: The given forces can be arranged as contact forces (Friction, Muscular force) and non-contact forces (Gravitational force, Magnetic force). Friction and muscular force are contact forces because they act between two surfaces or objects in direct physical contact, while gravitational and magnetic forces can act without any physical contact.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect arrangement would be to mix up the contact and non-contact forces. For example, placing the gravitational force (a non-contact force) before the friction force (a contact force) would be wrong. The correct order is to first list the contact forces (Friction, Muscular force) followed by the non-contact forces (Gravitational force, Magnetic force).
